rawIndexableTextContent: Rotate around a target location, effectively orbiting and keeping the camera trained on it.  Discussion Drag motions: The view converts vertical drag distance into an inclination above, or below, the target location, clamped to directly above and below it. The view converts horizontal drag distance into a rotational angle, orbiting the target location. A magnify gesture zooms in, or out, from the target location. Keyboard motions: The right-arrow and d keys rotate the camera to the right around the location. The left-arrow and a keys rotate the camera to the left around the location. The up-arrow and w keys rotate the camera upward around the location, clamped to a maximum of directly above the location. The down-arrow and s keys rotate the camera downward around the location, clamped to a minimum of directly below the location.
title: CameraControlARView.MotionMode.arcball
summary: Rotate around a target location, effectively orbiting and keeping the camera trained on it.

rawIndexableTextContent: The camera’s orbital distance from the target when in arcball mode.
title: radius
summary: The camera’s orbital distance from the target when in arcball mode.

rawIndexableTextContent: The speed at which keypresses change the angles of inclination or rotation.  Discussion This view doubles the speed valuewhen the key is held-down.
title: keyspeed
summary: The speed at which keypresses change the angles of inclination or rotation.

rawIndexableTextContent: The angle of inclination of the camera when in arcball mode.
title: inclinationAngle
summary: The angle of inclination of the camera when in arcball mode.

rawIndexableTextContent: The target for the camera when in arcball mode.
title: arcballTarget
summary: The target for the camera when in arcball mode.

rawIndexableTextContent: The mode in which the camera is controlled by keypresses and/or mouse and gesture movements.  Discussion The default option is CameraControlARView.MotionMode.arcball: CameraControlARView.MotionMode.arcball rotates around a specific target location, effectively orbiting and keeping the camera trained on that location. CameraControlARView.MotionMode.firstperson moves freely in all axis within the world space, not locked to any location.
title: motionMode
summary: The mode in which the camera is controlled by keypresses and/or mouse and gesture movements.

rawIndexableTextContent: Creates a new AR View with the camera controlled by mouse, keyboard, and/or the trackpad.  The frame rectangle for the view, measured in points. Discussion The default motion mode for the view is CameraControlARView.MotionMode.arcball, which orbits the camera around a specific point in space.
title: init(frame:)
summary: Creates a new AR View with the camera controlled by mouse, keyboard, and/or the trackpad.

rawIndexableTextContent: The mode of camera motion within the augmented reality scene.
title: CameraControlARView.MotionMode
summary: The mode of camera motion within the augmented reality scene.

rawIndexableTextContent: A SwiftUI representable view that wraps an underlying augmented reality view with camera controls instance.  Overview Create an CameraControlARView externally and hand it into the container so that you can interact with the view controls, or the underlying scene, from within SwiftUI.
title: ARViewContainer
summary: A SwiftUI representable view that wraps an underlying augmented reality view with camera controls instance.

rawIndexableTextContent: The speed at which drag operations map percentage of movement within the view to rotational or positional updates.
title: dragspeed
summary: The speed at which drag operations map percentage of movement within the view to rotational or positional updates.

rawIndexableTextContent: Updates the wrapped AR view with state information from SwiftUI.
title: updateNSView(_:context:)
summary: Updates the wrapped AR view with state information from SwiftUI.

rawIndexableTextContent: A reference to the camera anchor entity for moving, or reading the location values, for the camera.
title: cameraAnchor
summary: A reference to the camera anchor entity for moving, or reading the location values, for the camera.

rawIndexableTextContent: The speed at which the camera moves when incrementing forward via the keyboard
title: forward_speed
summary: The speed at which the camera moves when incrementing forward via the keyboard

rawIndexableTextContent: The angle of rotation of the camera when in arcball mode.
title: rotationAngle
summary: The angle of rotation of the camera when in arcball mode.

rawIndexableTextContent: The type of view this container wraps.
title: ARViewContainer.NSViewType
summary: The type of view this container wraps.

rawIndexableTextContent: Free motion within the AR scene, not locked to a location.  Discussion In general, the arrow keys or trackpad control where you’re looking and the a,s,d, and w keys move you around. Drag motions: A drag motion changes where the camera is looking. Keyboard motions: The d key moves the camera in a strafing motion to the right. The a key moves the camera in a strafing motion to the left. The w key moves the camera forward. The s key moves the camera backward. The right-arrow key rotates the camera to the right.. The left-arrow key rotates the camera to the left. The up-arrow key rotates the camera upward. The down-arrow key rotates the camera downward.
title: CameraControlARView.MotionMode.firstperson
summary: Free motion within the AR scene, not locked to a location.

rawIndexableTextContent: Creates a new SwiftUI view that wraps and displays an augmented reality view.  An instance of the camera-controlled AR View.
title: init(cameraARView:)
summary: Creates a new SwiftUI view that wraps and displays an augmented reality view.

rawIndexableTextContent: The wrapped ARView with camera controls enabled.
title: cameraARView
summary: The wrapped ARView with camera controls enabled.

rawIndexableTextContent: An augmented reality view for macOS that provides keyboard, trackpad, and mouse movement controls for the camera within the view.  Overview Set the motionMode to either: CameraControlARView.MotionMode.arcball for rotating around a specific point. CameraControlARView.MotionMode.firstperson for moving freely within the environment. The default motion mode is CameraControlARView.MotionMode.arcball. Additional properties control the target location, the camera’s location, or the speed of movement within the environment.
title: CameraControlARView
summary: An augmented reality view for macOS that provides keyboard, trackpad, and mouse movement controls for the camera within the view.

rawIndexableTextContent: The coordinator object that facilitates to and from the wrapped view.
title: ARViewContainer.ARViewCoordinator
summary: The coordinator object that facilitates to and from the wrapped view.

rawIndexableTextContent: The speed at which the camera moves when rotating using the keyboard
title: turn_speed
summary: The speed at which the camera moves when rotating using the keyboard

rawIndexableTextContent: An ARView with camera control and SwiftUI wrappers to use RealityKit with macOS. Overview The package provides an ARView subclass that you can use within AppKit, or with SwiftUI through a wrapping representable view. RealityKit includes an ARView that functions on macOS, but in a limited fashion. The subclassed ARView provides controls to move the camera within the RealityKit scene with a mouse, trackpad and/or keyboard. The wrapping SwiftUI view is crafted to allow you to create an instance of the CameraControlARView externally and provide it to the view. The following example view illustrates creating a view so that you can also access the underlying view’s properties to manipulate the view:
title: CameraControlARView
summary: An ARView with camera control and SwiftUI wrappers to use RealityKit with macOS.

rawIndexableTextContent: The homogenous transform that represents the camera’s location and rotation.
title: camera_transform
summary: The homogenous transform that represents the camera’s location and rotation.

rawIndexableTextContent: Creates a coordinator to establish the view and to pass updates to and from the SwiftUI context hosting the view.
title: makeCoordinator()
summary: Creates a coordinator to establish the view and to pass updates to and from the SwiftUI context hosting the view.
